headline: Crab Stuffed Mushrooms
description: Crab-stuffed mushrooms are a favorite appetizer or party treat and super-easy to make. Use fresh, canned, or imitation crabmeat in this speedy recipe.

video.description: Baked mushroom appetizers are stuffed with seasoned crabmeat.
video.name: Crab Stuffed Mushrooms

name: Crab Stuffed Mushrooms

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine crabmeat, green onions, thyme, oregano, savory, and pepper in a medium bowl. Mix in mayonnaise and 1/4 cup Parmesan until well combined. Refrigerate filling until ready to use.
Wipe mushrooms clean with a damp towel. Remove stems. Spoon out the gills and the base of the stem, making deep cups. Discard gills and stems.
Fill mushroom caps with rounded teaspoonfuls of filling and place them in an ungreased shallow baking dish. Sprinkle tops with Parmesan and paprika.
Bake mushrooms in preheated oven until heated through, about 15 minutes. Serve hot.

review.reviewBody: Put these on skewers and grilled them for the same time.. So good! Thanks for the delicious recipe. :)

They weren't bad. If I make again I would add garlic powder and no savoury. They also need some salt. Recipe as written doesn't pop and is underseasoned. 15 minutes is not long enough at 350. Needs a few more minutes. They weren't hot through. Just barely warm in the center.
I used cream cheese instead of mayo and it was awesome
It was very good!
very good
this is an amazing recipe and it's so easy! anyone who tried them when I made them loved them nothing but positive compliments!!
I looked good and maybe it was the type of crabmeat I used but I really did not like it at all.

Really very nice, we used a flat grilling plate on the grill, the mushrooms cooked beautifully. We substituted fresh herbs for dried. This recipe does not use bread crumbs , really makes it. Enough salt in the Parmesan. We served these with a small filet - great pairing!!!

I made it pretty much as stated, except I used portobello mushrooms and probably more crab than it called for. I also made it a main dish. 

It was excellent with the leftovers of the dungeoness crab from the previous night. I especially liked that it didn't call for cream cheese and breadcrumbs, as I feel those items are unnecessary fillers. I want the main ingredient to be crab and that's what I got with this recipe!

These Delicious Crab Stuffed Mushroom are Restaurant quality, so fast, easy, and Oh so good. I doubled the recipe.. makes about 40-50 mushrooms depending on size. Sprinkled old bay seasoning on the canned crab, used garlic powder instead of savory, and dusted the tops with cayenne pepper. Wells. been my favorite go to party
Delicious!! I didn't have savory, and I added some fresh mozzarella with the parmesan. I also mixed some of the stems with bread crumbs for a crunchy topping. SO good!!
They’re yummy Will make them again.

These have become a Christmas tradition for my son and I. The only change I've made is to use Old Bay seasoning instead of savory.
I always make a double recipe so I can have hot crab dip for New Years Eve.
The spices aren't a good combination. Makes it bitter tasting. Will use garlic salt or powder next time.
Easy enough buy spices overwhelmed the delicate taste of the crab meat.

As others said, mushrooms were watery and mushy. Should have used bread crumbs on top then broiled. Also didn’t have much flavor. If I make again will use 6 cheese Italian on top. Probably will try another recipe.
I didn’t spoon out the gills, they are yummy and nutritious. I drizzled with a pomegranate molasses. So good and pretty.
awesome

Understanding that most people who come here for recipes will generally take what is presented and modify it to their taste/needs, I found this recipe to be a great base from which to work. I used 12 ounces of mushrooms instead of a pound (because that amount can conveniently be found packaged in the produce section), 8 ounces of crab meat (Boss brand crab meat which comes in 8 ounce containers--and I used claw meat specifically), and changed all fractions to 1/2 for all other ingredients (so if it called for 1/4 teaspoon, I used 1/2 teaspoon, etc). I did not have savory, so didn't use it. I also substituted Old Bay seasoning for paprika (because Old Bay has paprika in it). I also used just a smidge of Lawry's Seasoned Salt. In the future, I will probably try experimenting with mixtures of Parmesan and either Mozzarella or Cheddar cheeses to make it a stringier texture.

This was really easy to make. I used 1/2 tsp of herbs de Provence since that was what I had instead of the thyme, organo, and savory. I baked mine for about 18 minutes because after 15, the filling still looked wet. Delicious!!
I made mine a meal, used imitation crab meat, and less green onion because mine were on the large side. There was enough filling for eight portobello mushrooms. Delish!

Will definently make again. Rather than using small mushrooms, I used the large caps approximately 5 inches across. I used claw crab meat rather than imitation, makes a world of difference. Was served as the main course. When using the large caps be sure to choose ones that are very thick. Otherwise they lose body. The thick ones cut like a steak with a crab stuffing topping. We did not use any of the bread crumbs. We aim for a very low carb diet.

These were amazing! Will def make again and keep this recipie. I didnt have any savory and i added garlic powder and some bacon bits. I cut up, sauteed & added some of the mushrooms I broke while trying to scoop out the gills.

so easy to make- I used shrimp instead of the crabmeat (needed that for the crab dip I'm also making!) I also added shredded mozzarella cheese to the filling, then sprinkled on top at the last 8 or 9 minutes. Can't wait to make these again!

Cut a VERY THIN FLAT LAYER of the top off the mushroom, then they don't roll around while you're stuffing and cooking. I made them in the air fryer, 360 for 9 minutes. I used baby bellas. I added sweet peppers and a little Worcestershire sauce, and skipped the savory because I don't have it. Next time I would use provolone or mozzarella to top with rather than the parmesan. Very good with some slight changes.

Very disappointed in how these tasted (average at best and weird spices for crab) and there wasn't enough creamy texture. I also agree with others that more cooking time is needed, because the mushrooms were raw.

We did not like these at all. Something about the flavor....it was missing something and we felt the oregano taste was strong. Would have been better made with cream cheese and breadcrumbs as others have said,

I really feel bad leaving a bad review in general, but in my opinion these are absolutely terrible. I am a home cooked meal - meat and potato kind of girl cooking with butter, all the seasonings, cheese, cream, etc. Typically I make stuffed mushrooms that are cream cheese-based versus mayo. I just can’t wrap my head around why the reviews are so great here. I’ll stick with my recipes.
Easy, tasty and no gluten!

Excellent base recipe. I added a bit of powdered mustard to make the stuffing more deviled. I topped each filled mushroom with a small square of mozzarella and sprinkled shaved Parmesan on top. They browned beautiful fully and tasted fantastic! Will make again!

I tried this recipe but I added minced onion, minced green peppers and garlic. If you don't want soggy mushrooms - bake the mushrooms cap side down on a baking sheet for 15 minutes in a 300 degree oven Remove from cookie sheet and place on a paper towel. Let them drain. Then when most the water has drained, fill them with the stuffing and proceed with the recipe. Soggy stuffed mushrooms aren't very appetizing.
Delicious! I used imitation crab. Seemed lighter and refreshing for summer appetizer!
So easiy and delicious. I used artificial crab chunks and it still turned out great.
These were Excellent! My changes and additional ingredients were chop the stems and gills fine
Excellent!
I could not find savory so I left it out, last time I tried replacing it with sage and it wasn't as good.

Delicious exactly according to the recipe. 
Yummy!!!
Put a little butter on top made a difference
Very good! Would definitely make again.

I used grated parm and topped with shaved parm. I also used garlic, yellow onion, garlic and a dash of cumin and cayenne pepper. Would have been better with green onion. Will definitely make it again.
There was none left last year when we made it first for a company get together. We've made it a few more times since for ourselves, but made it again due to the amount of requests!
They got gobbled up at a Christmas party yesterday. Several people wanted the recipe. Sorry, no pics. Could not find the "savory" seasoning at Whole Foods. I added a little bit or Bosari instead.
I used 2 large portobello mushroom tops to stuff. I sprayed them lightly with olive oil and cooked them in the air fryer at 325 for 20 mins.
I made it and loved it!
Amazing
Delicious! Great appetizer!
All of us loved it! Will definitely make it again...
To make them even better & more flavourful add 2-3 tbsp horseradish. That’s the KEY ingredient!!
Very delicious & easy.
I’ve had much better than this...not bad, just not stellar.
I used frozen imitation flake style crab meat, I didn't have savory so I used celery salt and they came out awesome
This recipe is very good and easy too. I served my guests and everyone loved it. Thanks for sharing!
I added more cheeses mozz and feta.....mmmm gooey good

I make these regularly, and they are delicious. When I didn't have savory, I substituted sage, and they turned out fine. Also once I didn't have green onions, so I substituted a smaller amount of red onion. Everyone who has tried them LOVES them, and they never stay on the plate for long!

Very tasty! Not a lot of work either! I used 4 jumbo white mushrooms, so the cooking time was 25 - 30 minutes. I used 1 can of canned crabmeat. Also, instead of the individual spices i just used the Costco brand Italian seasoning. Due to their size I served these to be eaten with a knife and fork - which seemed to make eating this yummy appetizer even more enjoyable!
I made the recipe as is and we enjoyed them.

I've made this twice. The first time it seemed to be missing something but was close to being what I wanted. 

I added 2 cloves of garlic, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil and 3 tablespoons of cream cheese. Baked 350 until mushrooms are nicely done, about 25min. I found this to be much more flavourful.
Used can crab, recipe said to rinse it had to squeese the heck out of it to get the water out. They turned out spectacular. Will chop up and add stems in next time

I used Phillips Lump Crab and organic mushrooms. It needs something to give it some zing. Maybe a bit of sirachha or tabasco sauce. If I wasn't gluten intolerant, I would have added some italian bread crumbs for some crunch. I would use it as a start of a good recipe and add additional ingredients.
What can I say I loved this recipe and have made it quite a few times
What can I say I loved this recipe and have made it quite a few times
This was so yummy I also added some celery and Old Bay Spice
These are fantastic as a main dish. Just add a Caesar or other side salad. I couldn't get savory, so I subbed Old Bay Seasoning. I will definitely make this yummy recipe again!

4.5/5 these guys are the perfect appetizer. So quick and easy too! I take the poor mans approach and use artificial crab and baby prawns instead. I also will sautee some shrimp in butter with garlic salt and pepper to pop on top when they are done! 
Very popular and gluten free too! Thanks!
I added a little more mayonnaise.

I used mozzarella instead of Parmesan .
They were absolutely delicious. I will makes these little treats again.
Added mozz. cheese and marinated in balsamic dressing before filling and added couple pinches of italian breadcrumbs
Made them twice, very good. Don't have savory so skipped it. Added a teaspoon of chopped garlic. Also works with minced yellow onion instead of green.
made it it was good

Was very disappointed; I followed recipe exactly except that I didn't have any scallions, so I omitted. I did use PINK crab from a can, which I never tried before. Mushrooms did not seem very tender and the filling was just mediocre. Maybe expectations were just too high, but I really did not like them.
Everyone raved about them! even the picky eaters! score!
I made these for New Years and they were a big hit.

I very much liked these, unfortunately my husband refused to try it because he hates crab so I don't have a second opinion. I agree with others that there isn't a strong crab taste (so know that ahead of time) but I did use canned crab. I added red bell pepper, a little lemon pepper, the stems, and paprika into the filling. I will definitely make again with a better quality crab.
I made these as an appetizer for Thanksgiving. Barely any were eaten and those who did try them said they tasted like dirt and everyone complained that the smell of them baking was terrible.
Not a fan of stuffed mushrooms. I didn't like this recipe at all.
I made these and they were phenomenal!! I had no mayo the last time I made them but I did have Philly Herb and Garlic spread and what an amazing touch as well :)
Great Recipe
I followed the recipe exactly and they turned out really good, the only thing I messed up on was using white button mushrooms instead of Portobellos.
They were dry and tasted odd. There are much better crab-stuffed mushroom recipes out there. I should have read the reviews, instead of simply relying on the star rating.
This was really good!

I wound up mixing the parmesan and the paprika in with the stuffing, and then sprinkled some extra paprika on top. I also substituted sage instead of savory and only used 1/4 yellow onion since I didn't have any green onions and we try not to use too much onion anymore and they turned out AMAZING! I will definitely make this again, the same way I made them tonight! Big hit!
Loved it!!
Did not add mayo but added imitation lobster to imitation crab plus mushroom stems. Used Stovetop Cornbread Stuffing. Needed salt but tasted better the next day.

I made this recipe with baby bella mushrooms, which I think may have required more cooking time than this recipe suggested. I also think I should've added breadcrumbs either in the stuffing or as a topping. Maybe some time under the broiler would've been good? They were good but not quite the taste I was looking for.
Yum! Yum! Yum! I don't know what savory is though, so I left that out. I used real crab meat and it was yummy. For an appetizer, it is pretty expensive, but it tastes great and seems really fancy.
I added some old bay and shallots instead of green onion. Old cheddar in place of Parmesan. Really good and simple.

I could not find savory at my grocery store (Publix) I substituted tarragon, based on my spice chart. the cooked mushrooms were bland and definitely missing something. I lied the fact that this recipe included crab and was "diet friendly". However, with the expense of crab meat & lack of flavor, I would not do again.

A big disappointment! Maybe it needed more mayo, or SOMETHING but it just didn't have any flavor! I added garlic powder, and I used Asiago cheese instead of Parmesan. Maybe it needed to be refrigerated for a longer time to let the flavors meld, or maybe it needed to be in the oven longer... this one has stumped me.
They were a little bland. I did not have savory so maybe that is why.

Fantastic, so delicious! Like some other reviewers, I also used garlic instead of savoury, included some extra grated old white cheddar in the mix instead of the extra parmesan (still sprinkled parmesan on the tops, of course) and I did, in fact, grease the baking dish with some butter. Also used fresh-packed immitation crabmeat. They were easy to make came out beautifully, and so yummy. A big hit with me and my guests. I will certainly be making these again, both when entertaining and for my own personal dinner. I also reheated the leftover filling the next day to make a wrap with some fresh spinach for my lunch and it was excellent.

Best recipe for stuffed mushrooms I've found!! My 5 year old daughter and I had a great time making them together and they were delicious!!! Wish we would've made more because they were gone in 15 minutes!! We did tweet the recipe just a little. We chopped the mushroom stems and added them to the filling. We also added cream cheese. Soooooo good!!! We are making them again tomorrow :)
Holy crow!! These were so easy and turned out amazing!
These were really good! I think next time I will add some granulated garlic.
Wasn't bad, but the parmesan cheese alone made it hard to chew and sort of bland. I'm going to replace the mayo with cream cheese next time and add in a soft cheese.
Great recipe! We added finely chopped roasted red bell pepper. Doesn't get better than that. Thanks

These sounded so easy and the recipe itself appealed to all of my Christmas guests. I made the recipe as written and was disappointed. We didn't eat half of them. Maybe next time I want to make a recipe like this, I will try using fresh crab meat (certainly more work) and add some panko. Sorry, these just weren't good.

Savory is a spice that is difficult to find, use a blend of dry thyme and dry sage (ground fine) 2/3 thyme and 1/3 sage blened well. This is what my mother used for savory. There is a group of spices known as savory and two of the best know are summer and winter. Just use the thyme and sage blend and you will enjoy the flavor of this recipe. Leave the 1/4 teaspoon of tyme out of the recipe as the tyme in the savory will be enough for the recipe.
it was like swag out of the oven #yolo oh and what does the fox say

I'd give this 3.5 stars if i could ... it was certainly good, but with some doctoring it could be terrific. I made these almost exactly as written (my parmesan on top was a little scant, and I forgot the paprika). Overall, I thought they ware good, but they were slightly undercooked (and my mushrooms were pretty small!), they were a little watery, and the onions were a tad too prominent. When I make them again -- and I will! -- I'll add some lemon juice, cut back on the onion a bit, and possibly add some bread crumbs or crushed bread stuffing to absorb some of the moisture. I'd also be really interested to try subbing cream cheese instead of the mayo. All that said, these are fairly tasty, easy, fast, and taste more caloric and indulgent than they are.
